content:
TITLE: Using hms Class for Time Manipulation in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates various ways to use the hms class, including creating hms objects, parsing time strings, converting to POSIXct, and using hms in a data frame.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
library(hms)

hms(56, 34, 12)
#> 12:34:56
as_hms(Sys.time())
#> 11:55:02.553476
parse_hms("12:34:56")
#> 12:34:56
as.POSIXct(hms(1))
#> [1] "1970-01-01 00:00:01 UTC"

data.frame(hours = 1:3, hms = hms(hours = 1:3))
#>   hours      hms
#> 1     1 01:00:00
#> 2     2 02:00:00
#> 3     3 03:00:00
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Internal Representation of hms Objects in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the internal representation of hms objects as number of seconds since 00:00:00, and shows how to convert between hms objects and numeric values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
times <- parse_hms(c("00:00:00.25", "00:00:01", "00:01:30", "01:00:00"))
times
#> 00:00:00.25
#> 00:00:01.00
#> 00:01:30.00
#> 01:00:00.00
times_num <- as.numeric(times)
times_num
#> [1]    0.25    1.00   90.00 3600.00
as_hms(times_num)
#> 00:00:00.25
#> 00:00:01.00
#> 00:01:30.00
#> 01:00:00.00
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Successful HMS Sequence Generation in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of valid sequence generation with HMS time values. Shows different ways to create sequences using along.with, length.out, and by parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/sequence.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
seq(hms(1), hms(4), along.with = 1:2)
seq(hms(1), hms(4), length.out = 2)
seq(hms(1), hms(4))
seq(hms(1), hms(4), by = hms(1))
seq(hms(4), hms(1))
seq(hms(4), hms(1), by = hms(-1))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Numeric Values to HMS Format with Millisecond Precision
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how the hms() function converts numeric values (in seconds) to hours:minutes:seconds.milliseconds format, including negative values, fractional seconds, and NA values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/colformat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
hms(c(-3600, -123.45 - 60, -1, -0.001, 0, 0.001, 1, 60, 123.45, 3600, NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Decimal Time Values to HMS Format with Centisecond Precision
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how hms() formats decimal time values with centisecond precision, handling negative values, zero, and irregular time values like 10000.23 seconds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/colformat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
hms(c(-4000.55, -3600, -60, 0, 180, 7200, 10000.23, NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Time Values with Millisecond Components to HMS Format
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how hms() handles fractional seconds (milliseconds) in the time representation, showing consistent formatting for both positive and negative values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/colformat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
hms(c(-60, -1, -0.001, 0, 0.001, 1, 60, NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Simple Time Values to HMS Format without Fractional Seconds
DESCRIPTION: Shows basic time value conversion using hms() without displaying fractional seconds. The example includes negative values, zero, and NA representation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/colformat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
hms(c(-60, -1, 0, 1, 60, NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Large Time Values to HMS Format
DESCRIPTION: Shows how the hms() function handles a wide range of numeric values representing seconds, including large negative and positive values. The output format adjusts to accommodate values over 1000 hours.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/colformat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
hms(c(-3600000, -3600, -60, -1, 0, 1, 60, 3600, 3600000, NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing hms Package in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows different ways to install the hms package in R, including installing the entire tidyverse, installing just hms, or installing the development version from GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
# The easiest way to get hms is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just hms:
install.packages("hms")

# Or the the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("tidyverse/hms")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Cases for HMS Sequence Generation in R
DESCRIPTION: Collection of test cases demonstrating error conditions when generating sequences with HMS time values. Tests include invalid class types, wrong sign in by argument, and invalid parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/sequence.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
seq(hms(1), 1)
seq(hms(4), hms(1), by = hms(1))
seq(hms(1), hms(4), by = hms(-1))
seq(hms(1), hms(4), by = "test")
seq(hms(1), hms(4), by = hms())
seq(hms(1), hms(4), by = hms(0))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dependencies Version Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing package dependencies and their version changes, including HMS package version and new dependencies vctrs and zeallot.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
|package |old   |new        |Î”  |
|:-------|:-----|:----------|:--|
|hms     |0.4.2 |0.4.2.9003 |*  |
|vctrs   |NA    |0.1.0      |*  |
|zeallot |NA    |0.1.0      |*  |
```

TITLE: Platform Configuration Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table displaying platform-specific configuration details including R version, operating system, language settings, and timezone information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
|field    |value                        |
|:--------|:----------------------------|
|version  |R version 3.5.3 (2019-03-11) |
|os       |Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch) |
|system   |x86_64, linux-gnu            |
|ui       |X11                          |
|language |(EN)                         |
|collate  |en_US.UTF-8                  |
|ctype    |en_US.UTF-8                  |
|tz       |Etc/UTC                      |
|date     |2019-04-16                   |
```

TITLE: Package Check Times Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A formatted markdown table showing check times for different packages. The table includes columns for package name, version number, and check time in minutes. The data is sorted by check time in descending order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/timing.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
|   |package   |version | check_time|
|:--|:---------|:-------|----------:|
|3  |readr     |1.0.0   |       19.2|
|5  |tidyverse |1.0.0   |       16.1|
|4  |scales    |0.4.1   |         13|
|2  |haven     |1.0.0   |       12.3|
|1  |feather   |0.3.1   |        9.9|
```

TITLE: Package Dependencies Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table listing installed R packages with their versions and sources, including HMS, lubridate, and testthat packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/problems-r-0.3.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
|package   |*  |version    |date       |source                           |
|:---------|:--|:----------|:----------|:--------------------------------|
|hms       |   |0.2        |2016-06-17 |cran (@0.2)                      |
|lubridate |   |1.6.0      |2016-09-13 |cran (@1.6.0)                    |
|testthat  |   |1.0.2.9000 |2016-08-25 |Github (hadley/testthat@46d15da) |
```

TITLE: Check Results for readr Package in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows a note from the R package check process for the readr package, indicating that the installed package size is large (11.7Mb) with most of the space used by the libs subdirectory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README-r-0.3.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
checking installed package size ... NOTE
  installed size is 11.7Mb
  sub-directories of 1Mb or more:
    libs  11.2Mb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Package Size Note for Readr Package
DESCRIPTION: Shows a NOTE from R package checking process for the 'readr' package indicating that the installed package size is large, particularly in the libs subdirectory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README-v0.2.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
checking installed package size ... NOTE
  installed size is 11.7Mb
  sub-directories of 1Mb or more:
    libs  11.2Mb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Check Results for haven Package in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows a note from the R package check process for the haven package, indicating that GNU make is listed as a system requirement in the package configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README-r-0.3.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
checking for GNU extensions in Makefiles ... NOTE
GNU make is a SystemRequirements.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GNU Extensions Note for Haven Package
DESCRIPTION: Shows a NOTE from R package checking process for the 'haven' package indicating that GNU make is listed as a SystemRequirement.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/hms/blob/main/revdep/README-v0.2.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
checking for GNU extensions in Makefiles ... NOTE
GNU make is a SystemRequirements.
```
